greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sigma(n^4).
comment: Here sigma(n^4) denotes the sums of divisors of n^4.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = (p^(4*e+1)-1)/(p-1) for prime p. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 23 2018
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := (p^(4*e + 1) - 1)/(p - 1); a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 50] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 10 2020 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 27 2011
